text: I tugged on Lucia’s finger and whispered, “Don’t rush in. Let’s circle around and find a way to save her from the shadows.”
The air in the basement was cold and clammy. Drops of water fell from the ceiling, shattering against the stone floor by my feet. I moved slowly along the wall, careful with every step.
🎲 [Agility Check: Failed] A piece of metal scraped under your boot, letting out a piercing metallic sound.
The sound was painfully loud in the silence of the underground chamber.
“Who’s there?!”
The robed leader snapped his head around, his voice cutting through the air like a whip. Several sigils lit up at once, blue flames condensing in their hands and forming into chains of energy.
“Damn—Lucia, run!”
Before I could react, a whip of energy struck the wall beside me, sparks flying. Shards of stone hit my shoulder, pain forcing the breath out of me.
“Get behind me!”
Lucia shouted, raising her staff and forcing out a barrier of light. The wall of radiance exploded before us, roaring as blue fire crashed against it like a storm unleashed.
“Intruders… those who disrupt the Cycle must be purged.”

The cold, ritualistic voice spread like a curse. The cultists raised their hands in unison, the rune circle glowing with a misty blue energy. Alicia hung suspended in midair, her talisman flaring violently.
“Lucia—cover me!”
I clenched my teeth and dashed out from behind the barrier. My short sword traced an arc through the air, severing two chains of light. The explosion of blue fire illuminated the entire chamber.
Lucia seized the opening, running toward Alicia. Her hands clasped together as she chanted the unlocking spell, her voice trembling and hurried.
Several of the cultists tried to gather power again, but a corner of the formation had been damaged in the blast—the flow of energy turned chaotic. The leader’s expression darkened.
“Fools! You have no idea what this ritual costs—”
Before he could finish, a surge of backlash erupted from the circle’s core, striking him square in the chest.
The explosion of light swallowed him—and all of our shadows along with him.
When my vision cleared, only charred remains were left of the chamber. Lucia was kneeling on the ground, and Alicia lay unconscious in my arms.
A numb sensation crept up my arm. Blood dripped down my skin, splattering onto the cold stone floor.
“She’s still breathing!”
Lucia looked up, her eyes rimmed with red.
“Move—let’s get out of here.”
My voice was hoarse, barely more than a growl.
We supported Alicia as we hurried up the stairs, every breath thick with the taste of dust.
The night air hit us like ice, snowflakes stinging against our faces like needles.
“...Don’t… move so fast…”
Her voice was so faint it was barely audible. Lucia immediately stopped and set her down on the ground.
I knelt beside them. Alicia raised a trembling hand, her fingertips glowing faintly. When she touched my wound, light seeped into my skin. Warmth spread through me as the pain eased away.
“It’s… a temporary seal. Your blood has been tainted by the ritual. Have it treated tomorrow.”
“What about you?”
“Don’t worry about me. Compared to me, you’re far more likely to be chosen by the ‘Cycle.’”
She looked at me, her gaze calm—too calm, unsettlingly so. I opened my mouth but found no words.
“We can’t stay here. The town guards must’ve heard that explosion.”
I nodded, lifted Alicia onto my back, and ran toward the inn through the falling snow.
Night had fully claimed the alley of scrap iron. Snowflakes drifted down, covering the scorched ground. The afterglow of the ritual still flickered in my mind—like an eye that refused to close.
